answerText: integral [or word forms][10] This integral, which is equivalent to the Riemann integral, is often used in real analysis. Its definition involves setting equal the supremum and infimum of the lower and upper sums of a partition of a closed interval.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 8 | 19 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This operation can be evaluated "by parts" or by using u-substitution. For ten points each: [10] Name this concept that is rigorously defined using Riemann sums and is the inverse operation of differentiation.
